sentences.en: According to Mandy, Pat's tough exterior hides a shy and sensitive soul.
sentences.cn: 据曼迪说，帕特彪悍的外表下隐藏着一颗害羞且敏感的心。

sentences.en: Alan doesn't shy away from controversy.
As a teenager, I was painfully shy (= extremely shy ) .
He died two days shy of his 95th birthday.
sentences.cn: 他在离95岁寿辰仅差两天时去世了。

sentences.en: He was a quiet shy man.
sentences.cn: 他是个话不多、害羞的男人。

sentences.en: He was shy and nervous as a boy, and unhappy at school.
sentences.cn: 他小时候既害羞又胆怯，在学校过得并不快乐。

sentences.en: He's quiet and a bit on the shy side.
Her normally shy son had come out of his shell.
sentences.cn: 她那平时很害羞的儿子已经开始与人交往了。

sentences.en: I feel awkward and shy in company.
sentences.cn: 跟别人在一起的时候，我觉得很别扭，不好意思。

sentences.en: I was something of a wallflower; I was terribly shy.
sentences.cn: 我算是朵墙花，因为我特别害羞。

sentences.en: Inarticulate and rather shy, he had always dreaded speaking in public.
sentences.cn: 他不善言辞又相当害羞，一直害怕在公共场合讲话。

sentences.en: She was a shy, ugly duckling of a child.
sentences.cn: 她小时候是个羞怯的丑小鸭。

sentences.en: The electric-power industry is gun-shy about building more large plants.
sentences.cn: 电力行业对新建大型电厂十分谨慎。

sentences.en: The publicity-shy singer spoke frankly in his first interview in three years.
sentences.cn: 这位不喜欢抛头露面的歌手在3年来的首次访谈中畅所欲言。

sentences.en: Underneath his outgoing behaviour Luke was shy.
sentences.cn: 在外向活泼的外表下，卢克其实很害羞。

sentences.en: Until now television had fought shy of covering by-elections.
sentences.cn: 迄今为止电视台一直竭力避免报道补缺选举。

sentences.en: We frequently shy away from making decisions.
sentences.cn: 我们常常害怕作出决定。

words.tran_cn: 害羞地；羞怯地；胆怯地；小心地

phrases.tran_cn: 回避，躲避；避免与…正面接触(或交锋)

trans.tran_cn: 害羞的，怕羞的，害怕（做），<美>缺乏的
trans.tran_en: nervous and embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people, especially people you do not know
nervous and embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people, especially people you do not know
if a horse shies, it makes a sudden movement away from something because it is frightened

trans.tran_cn: 惊退，畏缩，避开（某人），（用石子，球等）乱投
